feature.name: multiple-outcome-selection
feature.title: Multiple Outcome Comments Selection
feature.description: Allow users to select from multiple outcome comments when entering a grade that matches 2+ comments (~20% of entries, typically 2-3 matches). Expandable stack UI with simple text alternatives.

complexity.reasoning: Micro-complexity feature with 5 user stories, 1-2 weeks estimated effort, single/small developer team. No external API integrations (uses existing OutcomeComment data), no data migrations, no real-time processing, no specialized skills required. Simple React component with state management and local business logic.

usesExistingApis: OutcomeComment data already loaded in parent component

planning.notes: Minimal PRD, 5 user stories, and acceptance criteria complete. Feature ready for implementation.

architecture.reasoning: L1 complexity - architecture review not required. Design patterns follow existing FinalCommentsModal conventions.

implementation.notes: Frontend Engineer completed all 5 user stories using TDD. 107 tests passing. All acceptance criteria met.

validation.notes: QA Engineer validation complete. Test coverage 93%+ (exceeds >70% target). WCAG 2.1 AA compliant. Performance <15ms (target <100ms). All 107 tests passing. Component APPROVED FOR INTEGRATION.

businessValue.frequency: ~20% of entries have multiple matching outcome comments
businessValue.userImpact: Teachers can quickly select the most appropriate comment from alternatives, improving feedback consistency and reducing manual edit time. Enables reuse of curated comment library.
businessValue.timeSavingEstimate: 1-2 minutes per entry with alternatives (20% of entries = ~4-8 minutes per class of 30 students)

successMetrics.adoption: Track % of entries using multiple outcome selection feature
successMetrics.usability: Average time to select alternative comment (target: <5 seconds)
successMetrics.consistency: Measure feedback consistency improvements across multiple classes

stakeholders.primaryUsers: Teachers entering final comments for students
stakeholders.secondaryUsers: Students receiving feedback, Administrators reviewing comments
stakeholders.productTeam: Product Owner, Frontend Engineer, QA Engineer
stakeholders.communicationPlan: In-app tooltip on first use, brief release notes, optional training video

upstreamFeatures: Outcome Comments are loaded and filterable by grade
